info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:19PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties near Dilkon and portions of the Petrified Forest National Park through 500 PM MDT/400 PM MST/... At 417 PM MDT /317 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Dilkon to 11 miles southeast of Castle Butte to near Petrified Forest National Park. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph, heavy rain, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may result in muddy roads. Locations impacted include... Dilkon, Castle Butte, Tees Toh, Sun Valley, Cedar Springs, Petrified Forest National Park, Indian Wells and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 293 and 316. State Route 87 between mile markers 350 and 384. State Route 77 between mile markers 396 and 408. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to minor flooding and muddy road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways! Gusty outflow winds may precede any rain, thunder, or lightning!
